net.sf.javaml.filter.normalize

Class InstanceNormalizeMidrange

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.javaml.filter.AbstractFilter
      • net.sf.javaml.filter.normalize.InstanceNormalizeMidrange
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DatasetFilter, InstanceFilter

    public class InstanceNormalizeMidrange
extends AbstractFilter
    This filter will normalize all the attributes in an instance to a certain interval determined by a mid-range and a range. This class implements both the DatasetFilter and InstanceFilter interfaces. When you apply this filter to a whole data set, each instance will be normalized separately. For example mid-range 0 and range 2 would yield instances with attributes within the range [-1,1]. Each Instance is normalized separately. For example if you have three instances {-5;0;5} and {0;40;20} and you normalize with mid-range 0 and range 2, you would get {-1;0;1} and {-1;1;0}. The default is normalization in the interval [-1,1].
    Version:
    0.1.7
    Author:
    Thomas Abeel (thomas@abeel.be)
    See Also:
    InstanceFilter, DatasetFilter
